title: DSS application an application whose foundation of data is the data warehouse. dual database the practice of separating high-performance, transactionoriented data from decision-support data. dual database management systems the practice of using multiple database management systems to control different aspects of the database environment

Executive Information Systems (EIS) systems designed for the top executive, featuring drill-down analysis and trend analysis. explorer an individual who does not know what he or she wants at the outset of analysis. extract/load/transformation (ELT) the process of taking legacy application data and integrating it into the data warehouse. exploration warehouse a structure specifically designed for statistical processing that searches for business patterns. external data (1) data originating from other than the operational systems of a corporation; (2) data residing outside the central processing complex
fourth-generation language language or technology designed to allow the end user unfettered access to data
The Data Warehouse Database Explosion
A very good discussion of why volumes of data are growing as fast as they are in the data warehouse environment and what can be done about it
Data Element Definition
A good description of the definitions required in the system of record
What’s in a Name
A discussion of the implications of naming structures in the data warehouse environment
Informational Processing Architecture for Outcomes Management.” A description of data warehouse as it applies to health care and outcomes analysis
Towards an Outcomes Management Informational Processing Architecture
A discussion of the architected environment as it relates to healthcare
The Financial Impact of Data Warehousing
A description of the cost benefit analysis report done by IDC
The Foundations of Wisdom
International Data Corporation (Toronto, Canada). The definitive study on the return on investment for data warehouse, as well as the measurement of cost effectiveness
Vendors Are Our Friends
Doug Hackney talks about beneficial relationships with vendors
A Conceptual Model for Documenting Data Synchronization Requirements
Data synchronization and data warehouse
Data Warehouse Quality, Part 1
A description of data warehouse quality
Data Warehouse Quality, Part II
The second part of the discussion on data quality
End Users: Use ‘Em or Lose ‘Em
An excellent discussion of the ways to manage the end-user data warehouse effort
Data Quality in the Data Warehouse
A description of the parameters used to gauge the quality of warehouse data
Choosing the Correct Approach to Data Warehousing: ‘Big Bang’ vs. Iterative
A discussion of the proper strategic approach to data warehousing
Commentary: The Migration Path
A brief description of some of the issues of migrating to the data warehouse
Cost Justification in the Data Warehouse
A discussion of how to justify DSS and a data warehouse on the cost of reporting
Data Warehouse Lays Foundation for Bringing Data Investment Forward
A description of data warehouse and the relation to legacy systems
Data Warehouse Security: Encrypting Data
A description of some of the challenges of data warehouse security and industrial-strength security
The Future in History
A discussion of the value of historical information
Knowing Your DSS End-User: Tourists, Explorers, Farmers
A description of the different categories of end users
Managing the Data Warehouse: The Data Content Card Catalog
An introduction to the notion of a data content card catalog, that is, the stratification of data content
Managing the Data Warehouse Environment
Defining who the data warehouse administrator is
Measuring Capacity in the Data Warehouse
A discussion of how capacity should be measured in the data warehouse and DSS environment
Monitoring the Data Warehouse Environment
What a data monitor for the data warehouse environment is and why you would need it
Rethinking Data Relationships for Warehouse Design
A discussion of the issues data warehouse data relationships
SAP and the Data Warehouse
A description of why the data warehouse is still needed in the face of SAP
Security in the Data Warehouse: Data Privatization
A data warehouse requires a very different approach to security than the traditional VIEW-based approach offered by DBMS vendors

note: lightly summarized data, and highly summarized data.
title: Summary Data: The New Frontier
A description of the different types of summary data, including dynamic summary data, static summary data
User Reaction to the Data Warehouse
A description of the different user types in data warehousing
Virtual Data Warehouse: The Snake Oil of the ‘90s
A discussion of the virtual data warehouse and how the concept tries to attach itself to the legitimacy of the data warehouse

note: An interview with Bill Inmon in November of 1995 in Australia.
title: In the Words of Father Inmon
Data Warehouse Integrity: How Long and Bumpy the Road?
A discussion of the issues of data quality inside the data warehouse
The Doctor of DSS
An interview with Ralph Kimball
Break Old Habits to Define Data Warehousing Requirements
A description of how the end user should be approached to determine DSS requirements
Data Warehousing Fundamentals: What You Need to Know to Succeed
Several significant strategies for data warehousing to guide you through a successful implementation
Are OLAP and OLTP Like Twins?” DMR
A comparison of the two environments
An Interview with Bill Inmon
An interview discussing the start of data warehousing, the use of data warehousing for competitive advantages, the origins of Prism Solutions, and building the first data warehouse
Parallelism in the Database Layer
An excellent discussion of the differences between DSS parallelism and OLTP parallelism
Who Needs Scalable Systems?” DMR
A good discussion of the issues of scalability in the data warehouse environment
Creating Value through a Scalable Data Warehouse Framework
A very nice discussion of the data warehousing issues scale
Data Warehouses and Data Marts: Choose Your Weapon
A description of the differences between data marts and the current level detail of the data warehouse
Taking Your Data Warehouse to a New Dimension on the Intranet
A discussion of the different components of the data warehouse as they relate to the intranet
Modeling the Data Warehouse and the Data Mart
A description of architecture and modeling as it relates to different types of data warehouses

container-title: Books Adamson, Christopher, and Michael Venerable. Data Warehouse Design Solutions
title: Developing a Data Warehouse
A very good discussion of snapshots and the basic structures of a data warehouse
Data Warehouse Project Management
Data Mining Techniques
The Data Warehouse Challenge
Data Warehouse: From Architecture to Implementation
Oracle8i Data Warehousing
The CRM Handbook
E-data: Turning Data into Information with Data Warehousing
Improving Data Warehouse and Business Information Quality
Web Farming for the Data Warehouse
Building the Customer-Centric Enterprise
Building the Data Warehouse
Building the Data Warehouse
Building the Operational Data Store
Data Architecture: The Information Paradigm
Third Wave Processing: Database Machines and Decision Support Systems
Using the Data Warehouse
Data Stores, Data Warehousing and the Zachman Framework
Managing the Data Warehouse
Corporate Information Factory
Information Systems Architecture: Development in the 90s
RDB/VMS: Developing the Data Warehouse
Data Warehousing for E-Business
Understanding Data Pattern Processing
Data Warehouse Performance
Exploration Warehousing
Data Warehouse Management Handbook
Data Warehousing: The Key to Mass Customization
The Data Webhouse Toolkit
The Data Warehouse Lifecycle Toolkit
The Data Warehouse Toolkit: Practical Techniques for Building Dimensional Data Warehouses
Enterprise Information Technologies
Meta Data Repository
Intelligent Database Tools and Applications
The Data Model Resource Book Volume I
Document Warehousing and Text Mining
Accelerating Customer Relationships
Metadata Solutions
